question:
In context of the recent debate surrounding the Sri Lankan national anthem, consider the following statements:
  1. ‘Sri Lanka Matha’ is the Tamil version of the Sri Lankan national anthem.
  2. ‘Sri Lanka Thaaye’ is the Sinhala version of the anthem.
  3. Sri Lanka is the only country in the world with multilingual national anthem.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The ‘Sri Lanka Matha’ is the Sinhala version of the Sri Lankan national anthem. Recently, the Sri Lankan government announced that the anthem is to be sung only in the Sinhala language at the main Independence Day celebration in Colombo on 4th of February. Statement 2 is incorrect: Sri Lanka Thaaye is the Tamil version of the Sri Lankan national anthem. It is especially used in the northern and eastern parts of the country where the Tamils are concentrated. Previously, the Tamil version of the anthem was excluded from celebrations in 2016. Statement 3 is incorrect: Sri Lankan anthem is multilingual- sung in Tamil and Sinhala. There are other countries with multilingual national anthems. Eg: South African anthem is sung in 5 different languages. Other countries like New Zealand, Switzerland, Suriname, Belgium and Canada also have multilingual anthems.
